attrs.description: FusionCharts XT uses the concept of Color Palettes. Each chart has 5 pre-defined color palettes which you can choose from. Each palette renders the chart in a different color theme.
attrs.name: palette

attrs.description: While the `palette` attribute allows to select a palette theme that applies to chart background, canvas, font and tool-tips, it does not change the colors of data items (i.e., column, line, pie etc.). Using `paletteColors` attribute, you can specify your custom list of hex colors for the data items. The list of colors have to be separated by comma e.g., `"paletteColors": "#FF0000, #0372AB, #FF5904..."`. The chart will cycle through the list of specified colors and then render the data plot accordingly. To use the same set of colors throughout all your charts in a web application, you can store the list of palette colors in your application globally and then provide the same in each chart JSON.
attrs.range: List of hex color codes separated by comma
attrs.name: paletteColors

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control whether empty data sets in your data will be connected to each other OR do they appear as broken data sets.
attrs.name: connectNullData

attrs.description: It sets the configuration whether the x-axis labels will be displayed or not.
attrs.name: showLabels

attrs.description: This attribute can be used to set the maximum height for the x-axis labels (data labels) excluding the x-axis title. If any label goes beyond this height, the label will be truncated. In stagger mode, the number of stagger lines will be reduced if they exceed this value.
attrs.name: maxLabelHeight

attrs.description: When enabled in auto mode, long data labels are truncated by adding ellipses to prevent them from overflowing the chart background. The default value is 1.
attrs.name: useEllipsesWhenOverflow

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set whether the data labels will show up as rotated labels on the chart.
attrs.name: rotateLabels

attrs.description: Sets the configuration whether data values will be displayed along with the data plot on chart.
attrs.name: showValues

attrs.description: If you've opted to show data values on the chart, this attribute lets you adjust the vertical alignment of data values with respect to dataplots. By default, this attribute is set to AUTO mode in which the alignment of each data value is determined automatically based on the position of each plot point. In ABOVE mode, data values are displayed above the plot points unless a plot point is too close to the upper edge of the canvas while in BELOW mode, data values are displayed below the plot points unless a plot point is too close to the lower edge of the canvas.
attrs.name: valuePosition

attrs.description: If you've opted to show data values, you can rotate them using this attribute.
attrs.name: rotateValues

attrs.description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the upper limit of the chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by FusionCharts XT based on the data provided by you.
attrs.name: yAxisMaxValue

attrs.description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the lower limit of the chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by FusionCharts XT based on the data provided by you.
attrs.name: yAxisMinValue

attrs.description: If you opt to not rotate y-axis name, you can choose a maximum width that will be applied to y-axis name.
attrs.name: yAxisNameWidth

attrs.description: Whether to apply the shadow effects for data plot.
attrs.name: showShadow

attrs.description: If you do not wish to rotate y-axis name, set this as 0. It specifically comes to use when you've the special characters (UTF-8) in your y-axis name that do not show up in rotated mode.
attrs.name: rotateYAxisName

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set whether the y-axis lower limit will be 0 (in case of all positive values on chart) or should the y-axis lower limit adapt itself to a different figure based on values provided to the chart.
attrs.name: setAdaptiveYMin

attrs.description: Indicates whether the XML is in compact form or not.
attrs.name: compactDataMode

attrs.description: Specifies the separation character used in compact XML.
attrs.name: dataSeparator

attrs.description: Specifies the number of minor divisional lines to display between two major log divisions. If not specified the chart will automatically display certain number of minor divisional lines.
attrs.name: numMinorLogDivLines

attrs.description: Used for enabling/disabling the pin mode feature, which is active by default.
attrs.name: allowPinMode

attrs.description: Specifies the number of data labels that are to be visible in one screen.
attrs.name: numVisibleLabels

attrs.description: Sets the minimum distance in pixels at which to show anchors. This helps in making the chart clutter free.
attrs.name: anchorMinRenderDistance

attrs.description: Indicates the index of the data label that will appear to the extreme left of the chart.
attrs.name: displayStartIndex

attrs.description: Indicates the index of the data label that is to appear at the extreme right of the chart. Using `displayStartIndex` and `displayEndIndex` attributes you can set the range of data labels that'll be visible when the chart first renders.
attrs.name: displayEndIndex

attrs.description: Specifies the number of pixels to be used for producing a data point. A greater number will result in high quality display.
attrs.name: pixelsPerPoint

attrs.description: This attribute, when set to __1__, indicates to the chart that the text (rendered on the chart) may contain RTL characters and the textual display has to be managed accordingly.
attrs.name: hasRTLText

description: These attributes let you control a variety of functional elements on the chart. For example, you can opt to show/hide data labels, data values, y-axis values. You can also set chart limits and extended properties.

attrs.description: Caption of the chart.
attrs.name: caption

attrs.description: Sub-caption of the chart.
attrs.name: subCaption

attrs.description: X-axis title of the chart.
attrs.name: xAxisName

attrs.description: Y-axis title of the chart.
attrs.name: yAxisName

description: Using these attributes, you can set the various headings and titles of chart like caption, sub-caption, x-axis and y-axis names etc.

attrs.description: Sets horizontal alignment of caption
attrs.name: captionAlignment

attrs.description: Whether caption should be on top of the data plot area
attrs.name: captionOnTop

attrs.description: Sets the caption font size in pixels
attrs.name: captionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font size (in pixels)
attrs.name: subCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the caption font family
attrs.name: captionFont

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font family
attrs.name: subCaptionFont

attrs.description: Sets the caption font color
attrs.name: captionFontColor

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font color
attrs.name: subCaptionFontColor

attrs.description: Whether the caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: captionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the sub caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: subCaptionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the caption is aligned with the canvas. Else, it will be aligned with the entire chart area
attrs.name: alignCaptionWithCanvas

attrs.description:
If caption is not centre aligned, lets you configure the padding (in pixels) from either edge.
Will be ignored if caption is centre aligned.
attrs.name: captionHorizontalPadding

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of chart caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis font color
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the x-axis font size
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontSize

attrs.description: Whether x-axis font should be bold
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontBold

attrs.description: Whether x-axis font should be italicized
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for x-axis text
attrs.name: xAxisNameBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border around the x-axis text
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis alpha including font and background
attrs.name: xAxisNameAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis font alpha
attrs.name: xAxisNameFontAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis background alpha
attrs.name: xAxisNameBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border alpha
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border padding
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border radius
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis border thickness
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderThickness

attrs.description: Whether the x-axis border should be rendered using dashed lines
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes.
attrs.name: xAxisNameBorderDashGap

description: To configure the font cosmetics of x-axis name (title), you can use the following attributes.

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font family for the text
attrs.name: yAxisNameFont

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font color
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the y-axis (primary / secondary) font size
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontSize

attrs.description: Whether y-axis (primary / secondary) font should be bold
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontBold

attrs.description: Whether y-axis (primary / secondary) font should be italicized
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for y-axis (primary / secondary) text
attrs.name: yAxisNameBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border around the y-axis (primary / secondary) text
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) alpha including font and background
attrs.name: yAxisNameAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font alpha
attrs.name: yAxisNameFontAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) background alpha
attrs.name: yAxisNameBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border alpha
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border padding
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border radius
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border thickness
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderThickness

attrs.description: Whether y-axis (primary / secondary) border should be rendered using dashed lines
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes.
attrs.name: yAxisNameBorderDashGap

description: To configure the font cosmetics of y-axis name (title), you can use the following attributes.

attrs.description: Whether to show a border around the chart or not.
attrs.name: showBorder

attrs.description: Border color of the chart.
attrs.name: borderColor

attrs.description: Border thickness of the chart.
attrs.name: borderThickness

attrs.description: Border alpha of the chart.
attrs.name: borderAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute. To specify a gradient as background color, separate the hex color codes of each color in the gradient using comma. Example: `#FF5904, #FFFFFF`.
attrs.name: bgColor

attrs.description: Sets the alpha (transparency) for the background. If you've opted for gradient background, you need to set a list of alpha(s) separated by comma.
attrs.name: bgAlpha

attrs.description: If you've opted for a gradient background, this attribute lets you set the ratio of each color constituent.
attrs.name: bgRatio

attrs.description: Sets the angle of the background color, in case of a gradient.
attrs.name: bgAngle

attrs.description: To place any image (JPG/PNG/GIF) as background of the chart, enter the (path and) name of the background image. It should be in the same domain as the chart.
attrs.name: bgImage

attrs.description: This attribute specifies the opacity for the loaded background image.
attrs.name: bgImageAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you specify the mode in which the background image is to be displayed. Stretch - expands the image to fit the entire chart area, without maintaining original image constraints. Tile - the image is repeated as a pattern on the entire chart area. Fit - fits the image proportionately on the chart area. Fill -proportionately fills the entire chart area with the image. Center - the image is positioned at the center of the chart area. None - Default mode.
attrs.range: stretch, tile, fit, fill, center, none
attrs.name: bgImageDisplayMode

attrs.description: Helps you to vertically align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageVAlign

attrs.description: Helps you to horizontally align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageHAlign

attrs.description: Helps you magnify the background image.This attribute will only work when the attribute `bgImageDisplayMode` is set to none, center, or tile.
attrs.name: bgImageScale

attrs.description: Sets color of the x-axis of the chart.
attrs.name: xAxisLineColor

attrs.description: Sets Canvas background color. For Gradient effect, enter colors separated by comma.
attrs.name: canvasBgColor

attrs.description: Sets alpha for Canvas Background. For gradient, enter alpha list separated by commas.
attrs.name: canvasBgAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you specify canvas background ratio for gradients.
attrs.name: canvasBgRatio

attrs.description: Helps you specify canvas background angle in case of gradient.
attrs.name: canvasBgAngle

attrs.description: Lets you specify canvas border color.
attrs.name: canvasBorderColor

attrs.description: Lets you specify canvas border thickness.
attrs.name: canvasBorderThickness

attrs.description: Lets you control transparency of canvas border.
attrs.name: canvasBorderAlpha

attrs.description: If you've opted to show a label for any of your vLines in the chart, you can collectively configure whether to show border for all such labels using this attribute. If you want to show label border for just a particular vLine, you can over-ride this value by specifying border configuration for that specific vLine.
attrs.name: showVLineLabelBorder

attrs.description: You can load an external logo (JPEG/PNG) to your chart, this attribute lets you specify the URL. Due to cross domain security restrictions it is advised to use a logo from the same domain name as your charts.
attrs.name: logoURL

attrs.description: Where to position the logo on the chart: TL - Top-left TR - Top-right BR - Bottom right BL - Bottom left CC - Center of screen
attrs.name: logoPosition

attrs.description: Once the logo has loaded on the chart, you can configure its opacity using this attribute.
attrs.name: logoAlpha

attrs.description: You can also change the scale of an externally loaded logo at run-time by specifying a value for this parameter.
attrs.name: logoScale

attrs.description: If you want to link the logo to an external URL, specify the link in this attribute. The link can be in FusionCharts Link format, allowing you to link to new windows, pop-ups, frames etc.
attrs.name: logoLink

attrs.description: Specifies a color theme that will be applied throughout the chart.
attrs.name: paletteThemeColor

attrs.description: Sets the color of the toolbar buttons.
attrs.name: toolbarButtonColor

attrs.description: Sets the color of the zoom pane border.
attrs.name: zoomPaneBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the background color of the zoom pane.
attrs.name: zoomPaneBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the alpha of the zoom pane.
attrs.name: zoomPaneBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the thickness of the pinned line when the chart is put to pin line mode.
attrs.name: pinLineThicknessDelta

attrs.description: Sets the background color of the pin pane.
attrs.name: pinPaneBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the alpha of the pin pane.
attrs.name: pinPaneBgAlpha

attrs.description: Enables/disables display of tooltips for toolbar buttons.
attrs.name: showToolBarButtonTooltext

attrs.description: Replaces the default tooltext of the 'Reset Chart' button with provided string.
attrs.name: btnResetChartTooltext

attrs.description: Replaces the default tooltext of 'Switch to Pin Mode' button with provided string.
attrs.name: btnSwitchToPinModeTooltext

description: The following attributes let you configure chart cosmetics like background color, background alpha, canvas color & alpha etc.

attrs.description: Color using which the lines on the chart will be drawn.
attrs.name: lineColor

attrs.description: Thickness of the lines on the chart.
attrs.name: lineThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of the lines on the chart.
attrs.name: lineAlpha

description: These attributes let you configure how your plot (columns, lines, area, pie or any data that you're plotting) will appear on the chart. If the plots can show borders, you can control the border properties using the attributes listed below. Or, if they support gradient fills, you can again configure various properties of the gradient using these attributes. Various other controls over plot cosmetics can be attained using this set of attributes.

attrs.description: Sets the font of the values in the chart
attrs.name: valueFont

attrs.description: Specifies the value font color
attrs.name: valueFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the value font size
attrs.name: valueFontSize

attrs.description: Whether value font should be bold
attrs.name: valueFontBold

attrs.description: Whether value font should be italicized
attrs.name: valueFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for value text
attrs.name: valueBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border color around the value text
attrs.name: valueBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the value alpha including font and background
attrs.name: valueAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value font alpha
attrs.name: valueFontAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value background alpha
attrs.name: valueBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value border alpha
attrs.name: valueBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value border thickness
attrs.name: valueBorderThickness

attrs.description: Sets the value border radius
attrs.name: valueBorderRadius

attrs.description: Whether the border around the value should be rendered as a dashed border
attrs.name: valueBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes.
attrs.name: valueBorderDashGap

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash
attrs.name: valueBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the value alpha on hover
attrs.name: valueHoverAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value font alpha on hover
attrs.name: valueFontHoverAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value background alpha on hover
attrs.name: valueBgHoverAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the value border alpha on hover
attrs.name: valueBorderHoverAlpha

attrs.description: Displays the value while dataplot on hover
attrs.name: showValuesOnHover

description: These attributes let you configure font, background and border cosmetics, of value text-field that appear for each data plot.

attrs.description:
Specifies whether peak data will be shown. 

Default value: 0 (disabled)
attrs.name: showPeakData

attrs.description: Defines the upper limit for peak data. Any value greater than this value will be considered peak data.
attrs.name: maxPeakDataLimit

attrs.description: Defines the lower limit for peak data. Any value lesser than this value will be considered peak data.
attrs.name: minPeakDataLimit

description: These attributes let you enable peak data to be shown on the chart and set limits for it.

attrs.description: Color for scroll bar.
attrs.name: scrollColor

attrs.description: Required height for scroll bar.
attrs.name: scrollHeight

description: The following attributes let you set the scroll bar properties.

attrs.description: Whether to draw anchors on the chart.
attrs.name: drawAnchors

attrs.description: This attribute sets the radius (in pixels) of the anchor.
attrs.name: anchorRadius

attrs.description: Lets you set the border color of anchors.
attrs.name: anchorBorderColor

attrs.description: Helps you set border thickness of anchors.
attrs.name: anchorBorderThickness

attrs.description: Helps you set the background color of anchors.
attrs.name: anchorBgColor

attrs.description: Helps you set the alpha of anchor background.
attrs.name: anchorBgAlpha

description: On line/area charts, anchors (or marker points) are polygons which appear at the joint of two consecutive lines/area points. These are indicators to show the position of data points. The anchors handle tool tips for the data points. So, if you opt to not render anchors on a chart, the tool tips won't function. You can, however, hide them by setting alpha to 0 and still enable tool tips. You can customize all the facets of anchors using the properties below.

attrs.description: Color for divisional lines.
attrs.name: divLineColor

attrs.description: Thickness of divisional lines.
attrs.name: divLineThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of divisional lines.
attrs.name: divLineAlpha

attrs.description: Whether the divisional lines should be displayed as dashed lines instead of whole lines.
attrs.name: divLineDashed

attrs.description: If the divisional lines are to be displayed as dashed lines, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash.
attrs.name: divLineDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes.
attrs.name: divLineDashGap

attrs.description: Color for the Zero Plane. Zero Plane is the line/plane that appears at position 0 on the y-axis, when negative data is being shown on the chart.
attrs.name: zeroPlaneColor

attrs.description: Thickness of zero plane.
attrs.name: zeroPlaneThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of zero plane.
attrs.name: zeroPlaneAlpha

attrs.description: Allows you to show or hide the value on which the zero plane exists on the y-axis. By default, the value is displayed.
attrs.name: showZeroPlaneValue

attrs.description: Whether to show alternate colored horizontal grid bands.
attrs.name: showAlternateHGridColor

attrs.description: Color of the alternate horizontal grid bands.
attrs.name: alternateHGridColor

attrs.description: Alpha (transparency) of the alternate horizontal grid bands.
attrs.name: alternateHGridAlpha

description: Using this set of attributes, you can control the properties of divisional lines, zero plane and alternate color bands. Divisional Lines are horizontal lines running through the canvas. Each divisional line signifies a smaller unit of the entire axis thus aiding the users in interpreting the chart. The zero plane is a 2D/3D plane that signifies the 0 position on the chart. If there are no negative numbers on the chart, you won't see a visible zero plane. Alternate color bands are colored blocks between two successive divisional lines.

attrs.description: Whether to show legend on the chart.
attrs.name: showLegend

attrs.description: Whether legend keys should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: legendItemFontBold

attrs.description: Sets legend item font
attrs.name: legendItemFont

attrs.description: Sets legend item font size
attrs.name: legendItemFontSize

attrs.description: Sets legend item font color
attrs.name: legendItemFontColor

attrs.description: Sets legend item font color on hover
attrs.name: legendItemHoverFontColor

attrs.description: The legend can be plotted at two positions on the chart - below (BOTTOM) the chart and to the right (RIGHT) of the chart.
attrs.name: legendPosition

attrs.description: Sets the legend caption horizontal alignment .
attrs.name: legendCaptionAlignment

attrs.description: Whether legend caption should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontBold

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font
attrs.name: legendCaptionFont

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font size
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font color
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontColor

attrs.description: You can add a caption for the entire legend by setting the same here.
attrs.name: legendCaption

attrs.description: Sets the color that applies on both text font and icon when they are in a  disabled / hidden state
attrs.name: legendItemHiddenColor

attrs.description: Scaling of legend icon is possible in FusionCharts XT. This attribute lets you control the size of legend icon.
attrs.name: legendIconScale

attrs.description: Background color for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBgColor

attrs.description: Background alpha for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBgAlpha

attrs.description: Border Color for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderColor

attrs.description: Border thickness for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderThickness

attrs.description: Border alpha for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Whether to show a shadow for legend.
attrs.name: legendShadow

attrs.description: The legend can be made drag-able by setting this attribute to 1. End viewers of the chart can drag the legend around on the chart.
attrs.name: legendAllowDrag

attrs.description: If you've too many items on the legend, a scroll bar shows up on the same. This attribute lets you configure the background color of the scroll bar.
attrs.name: legendScrollBgColor

attrs.description: You can reverse the ordering of datasets in the legend by setting this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: reverseLegend

attrs.description: This attribute lets you interact with the legend in your chart. When you click a legend key, the dataplots associated with that series are eliminated from the chart. Re-clicking the key causes the dataplots to reappear.
attrs.name: interactiveLegend

attrs.description: If your chart contains multiple series, the legend is displayed as a grid comprising of multiple legend keys. With the help of this attribute you can specify the number of columns that are to be displayed in the legend.
attrs.name: legendNumColumns

attrs.description: Whether to minimize legend item text wrapping.
attrs.name: minimiseWrappingInLegend

attrs.description:
Specifies whether drawing a custom legend icon will be enabled. All legend icon customization attributes will work only if this feature is enabled. 

Default value: 0 (disabled)
attrs.name: drawCustomLegendIcon

attrs.description:
Sets the border color for the legend icon. 

Default value: Data plot border color
attrs.name: legendIconBorderColor

attrs.description:
Sets the background color for the legend icon. 

Default value: Data plot fill color
attrs.name: legendIconBgColor

attrs.description:
Sets the legend icon transparency. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: legendIconAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the legend icon background transparency. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: legendIconBgAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the number of sides for the legend icon. 

Default value: 4
attrs.name: legendIconSides

attrs.description:
Sets the thickness of the legend icon border. 

Default value: 1
attrs.name: legendIconBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Sets the starting angle of for drawing the legend icon. 

Default value: 45
attrs.name: legendIconStartAngle

description: In multi-series charts, the series name of each dataset shows up in the legend of the chart. If you do not need the legend, you can opt to hide the same. Also, the legend can be placed at the bottom of the chart or to the right of the chart. Using the attributes below, you can configure the functional and cosmetic properties of the legend.

attrs.description: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if 'formatNumber': '1'; and 40000 if 'formatNumber': '0';.
attrs.name: formatNumber

attrs.description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if `formatNumberScale` is set to 1, 10434 will become 1.04K . Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
attrs.name: formatNumberScale

attrs.description: The default unit of the numbers that you're providing to the chart.
attrs.name: defaultNumberScale

attrs.description: Unit of each block of the scale.
attrs.name: numberScaleUnit

attrs.description: Range of the various blocks that constitute the scale.
attrs.name: numberScaleValue

attrs.description:
Forces the specified lower `numberScaleUnit` value to be applied to data values less than the specified `numberScaleValue`. This attribute works only when `“formatNumberScale”: “1”` and the `defaultNumberScale` attribute is not defined. 

For example, if `“numberScaleUnit”: “K, M”`, `“numberScaleValue”: “1000, 1000”`, and `“forceNumberScale”: “1”`, a data value of __400__ will be rendered as __0.40K__.
attrs.name: forceNumberScale

attrs.description: Whether recursive scaling should be applied.
attrs.name: scaleRecursively

attrs.description: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling? -1 completes the entire set of recursion.
attrs.name: maxScaleRecursion

attrs.description: What character to use to separate the scales that are generated after recursion?
attrs.name: scaleSeparator

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to $ to show like $40000, $50000.
attrs.name: numberPrefix

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figures quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to '/a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a.
attrs.name: numberSuffix

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the decimal separator in a number.
attrs.name: decimalSeparator

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the thousands separator in a number.
attrs.name: thousandSeparator

attrs.description: This option helps you specify the position of the thousand separator.
attrs.name: thousandSeparatorPosition

attrs.description: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to.
attrs.name: decimals

attrs.description: Whether to add 0 padding at the end of decimal numbers. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all the numbers, set this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: forceDecimals

attrs.description: Whether to forcefully attach decimal places to all y-axis values. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all y-axis numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all y-axis numbers, set this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: forceYAxisValueDecimals

attrs.description: If you've opted to not adjust div lines, you can specify the div line values decimal precision using this attribute.
attrs.name: yAxisValueDecimals

description: FusionCharts XT offers you a lot of options to format your numbers on the chart. Using the attributes below, you can control a myriad of options like: Formatting of commas and decimals Number prefixes and suffixes Decimal places to which the numbers will round to Scaling of numbers based on a user defined scale Custom number input formats

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart. If you specify the `outCnvBaseFont` attribute also, then this attribute controls only the font face of text within the chart canvas bounds.
attrs.name: baseFont

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.
attrs.name: baseFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.
attrs.name: baseFontColor

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font family of the chart text which lies outside the canvas i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font name provided here.
attrs.name: outCnvBaseFont

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.
attrs.name: outCnvBaseFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie outside the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.
attrs.name: outCnvBaseFontColor

description: Using the attributes below, you can define the generic font properties for all the text on the chart. These attributes allow you a high level control over font properties. If you intend to specify font properties for individual chart elements (like Caption, sub-caption etc.), you'll need to use the Styles feature of FusionCharts XT. Using Styles, you can also specify advanced font properties like Bold, Italics, HTML Mode etc.

attrs.description: Whether to show tool tip on chart.
attrs.name: showToolTip

attrs.description: Background color for tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipBgColor

attrs.description: Font color for the tool-tip.
attrs.name: toolTipColor

attrs.description: Border color for tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipBorderColor

attrs.description: The character specified as the value of this attribute separates the name and value displayed in tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipSepChar

attrs.description: Whether to show shadow for tool-tips on the chart.
attrs.name: showToolTipShadow

attrs.description: There are two ways of displaying tool-tips in a zoomline chart. One is to use a cross-line, which is a vertical line that displays data values for all series on that data point. The other way is to use traditional tool-tips that display values on a data point when hovered upon. Default value is 1 which uses cross-line. Set this attribute value to 0 to use traditional tool-tips.
attrs.name: useCrossLine

description: These attributes let you control the tool tip. You can set the background color, border color, separator character and few other details.

attrs.description: Whether to enable hover effect on charts for all elements
attrs.name: showHoverEffect

attrs.description: Whether to enable hover effect on charts for data plots (e.g., column, pie) only
attrs.name: plotHoverEffect

attrs.description: Specifies the hover color for the data plots
attrs.name: plotFillHoverColor

attrs.description: Specifies the hover alpha for data plots
attrs.name: plotFillHoverAlpha

description: If you wish to show an effect on the data plot (column, line anchor, pie etc.) when the user hovers his mouse over the data plot, these attributes let you configure the cosmetics of the hover for all data plots in the chart.

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control the space (in pixels) between the sub-caption and top of the chart canvas. If the sub-caption is not defined, it controls the space between caption and top of chart canvas. If neither caption, nor sub-caption is defined, this padding does not come into play.
attrs.name: captionPadding

attrs.description: Using this, you can set the distance between the top end of x-axis title and the bottom end of data labels (or canvas, if data labels are not to be shown).
attrs.name: xAxisNamePadding

attrs.description: Using this, you can set the distance between the right end of y-axis title and the start of y-axis values (or canvas, if the y-axis values are not to be shown).
attrs.name: yAxisNamePadding

attrs.description: This attribute helps you set the horizontal space between the canvas left edge and the y-axis values or trend line values (on left/right side). This is particularly useful, when you want more space between your canvas and y-axis values.
attrs.name: yAxisValuesPadding

attrs.description: It sets the vertical space between the end of columns and start of value textboxes. This basically helps you control the space you want between your columns/anchors and the value textboxes.
attrs.name: valuePadding

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the left side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartLeftMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the right side of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartRightMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put on the top of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartTopMargin

attrs.description: Amount of empty space that you want to put at the bottom of your chart. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: chartBottomMargin

attrs.description: Padding of legend from right/bottom side of canvas
attrs.name: legendPadding

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control the space between the start of chart canvas and the start (x) of chart. In case of 2D charts, the canvas is the visible rectangular box. In case of 3D charts, the canvas box is the imaginary box around the 3D canvas. Using this attribute, you can control the amount of empty space between the chart left side and canvas left side. By default, FusionCharts XT automatically calculates this space depending on the elements to be placed on the chart. However, if you want to over-ride this value with a higher value, you can use this attribute to specify the same. Please note that you cannot specify a margin lower than what has been calculated by the chart. This attribute is particularly useful, when you've multiple charts placed in a page and want all their canvas start position to align with each other - so in such a case, you can set same margin value (a value large enough that it doesn't get rejected by chart owing to it being lower than the calculated value) for all such charts in the page.
attrs.name: canvasLeftMargin

attrs.description: Like `canvasLeftMargin`, this attribute lets you set the space between end of canvas and end of chart.
attrs.name: canvasRightMargin

attrs.description: Like `canvasLeftMargin`, this attribute lets you set the space between top of canvas and top of chart.
attrs.name: canvasTopMargin

attrs.description: Like `canvasLeftMargin`, this attribute lets you set the space between bottom of canvas and bottom of chart.
attrs.name: canvasBottomMargin

description: The following attributes help you control chart margins and paddings. FusionCharts Suite XT allows you to manually customize the padding of various elements on the chart to allow advanced manipulation and control over chart visualization. You can also define the chart margins. Chart Margins refer to the empty space left on the top, bottom, left and right of the chart. That means, FusionCharts Suite XT will not plot anything in that space. It's not necessary for you to specify any padding/margin values. FusionCharts Suite XT automatically assumes the best values for the same, if you do not specify the same.

attrs.description: Lets you specify font face for the x-axis data labels.
attrs.name: font

attrs.description: Lets you specify font color for the x-axis data labels.
attrs.name: fontColor

attrs.description: Lets you specify font size for the x-axis data labels.
attrs.name: fontSize

description: The `categories` object and the `category` object (child of  the `categories` object)  are used to specify x-axis labels for multi-series charts. The attributes of the `categories` object are used to set the font properties of all x-axis labels collectively.

attrs.description: Lets you specify the series name for a particular dataset. For example, if you're plotting a chart to indicate monthly sales analysis for 2005 and 2006, the `seriesName` for the first dataset will be 2005 and that of the second will be 2006. The `seriesName` of a dataset is shown in legend.
attrs.name: seriesName

attrs.description: This attribute sets the color using which line of that dataset will be drawn
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: This attribute sets the alpha (transparency) of the entire dataset.
attrs.name: alpha

attrs.description: Whether to show the values for this dataset.
attrs.name: showValues

attrs.description: This attribute lets you adjust the vertical alignment of data values for all dataplots in the dataset. The alignment is set with respect to the position of the dataplots on the chart. By default, the attribute is set to AUTO mode in which the alignment of each data value is determined automatically based on the position of each plot point. In ABOVE mode, data values are displayed above the plot points unless a plot point is too close to the upper edge of the canvas. While in BELOW mode, data values are displayed below the plot points unless a plot point is too close to the lower edge of the canvas. The attribute will function only if showValue attribute is set to 1 in this particular dataset.
attrs.name: valuePosition

attrs.description: Whether to draw anchors for the particular dataset.
attrs.name: drawAnchors

attrs.description: This attribute sets the radius (in pixels) of the anchors of the particular dataset.
attrs.name: anchorRadius

attrs.description: Thickness of the lines for the particular dataset.
attrs.name: lineThickness

attrs.description: Lets you set the border color of anchors of the particular dataset.
attrs.name: anchorBorderColor

attrs.description: Helps you set border thickness of anchors of the particular dataset.
attrs.name: anchorBorderThickness

attrs.description: Helps you set the background color of anchors of the particular dataset.
attrs.name: anchorBgColor

attrs.description: Helps you set the alpha of anchor background of the particular dataset.
attrs.name: anchorBgAlpha

attrs.description: Whether to include the seriesName of this dataset in legend.
attrs.name: includeInLegend

attrs.description: Whether the line should appear as dashed.
attrs.name: dashed

description: Each `dataset` object contains a series of data. For example, for a monthly sales comparison chart for two successive years, the first data-set would contain the data for first year and the next one for the second year. You can provide data-set level cosmetics so that all data within that data-set will be plotted in the same color/alpha/etc. Depending on the chart type, there are a number of attributes that you can define for each `dataset` object.

attrs.description: Numerical value for the data item. This value will be plotted on the chart.
attrs.name: value

attrs.description: If instead of the numerical value of this data, you wish to display a custom string value, you can specify the same here. Examples are annotation for a data item etc.
attrs.name: displayValue

attrs.description: By default, FusionCharts XT shows the value as tool tip text for that data item. But, if you want to display more information for the data item as tool tip, you can use this attribute to specify the same.
attrs.name: toolText

attrs.description: Whether to show the trend line value on left side or right side of chart. This is particularly useful when the trend line display values on the chart are colliding with divisional lines values on the chart.
attrs.name: valueOnRight

attrs.description: Color of the trend line and its associated text
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: Whether the trend will be displayed as a line or a zone (fill-colored rectangle).
attrs.name: isTrendZone

attrs.description: Whether the trend line/zone will be displayed over data plots or under them.
attrs.name: showOnTop

attrs.description: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define the thickness of trend line.
attrs.name: thickness

attrs.description: Alpha of the trend line.
attrs.name: alpha

attrs.description: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define whether the trend line will appear as dashed.
attrs.name: dashed

attrs.description: If you've opted to show trend line as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash.
attrs.name: dashLen

attrs.description: If you've opted to show trend line as dash, this attribute lets you control the length of each dash gap.
attrs.name: dashGap

attrs.description: The starting value for the trendline. Say, if you want to plot a slanted trendline from value 102 to 109, the `startValue` will be 102.
attrs.name: startValue

attrs.description: The ending y-axis value for the trendline. Say, if you want to plot a slanted trendline from value 102 to 109, the `endValue` will be 109. If you do not specify a value for `endValue`, it will automatically assume the same value as `startValue`.
attrs.name: endValue

attrs.description: If you want to display a string caption for the trend line by its side, you can use this attribute. Example:` displayValue='Last Month High'`. When you don't supply this attribute, it automatically takes the value of `startValue`.
attrs.name: displayValue

attrs.description: Custom tool-text for this trendline/zone.
attrs.name: toolText

description:
Trend-lines are horizontal lines that aid in interpretation of data with respect to some pre-determined value. For example, if you are plotting the sales data for the current year, you might want to show the previous year's average monthly sales as a trend indicator for ease of comparison. The `lines` object, child of the `trendlines` object is used to add trend-lines to a chart.

Although the `line` object has to be defined within the `trendlines` object, the latter cannot be used to collectively customize trend-lines, because it does not have any attributes of its own.

The attributes of the `lines` object, child of the `trendlines` object, are used to create and customize trend-lines for charts.

attrs.description: Sets the font family for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueFont

attrs.description: Sets the font size for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueFontSize

attrs.description:
Sets whether the trend-line display value will be bold formatted. 

Default value: 0 (not bold formatted)
attrs.name: trendValueFontBold

attrs.description:
Sets whether the trend-line display value will be italicized. 

Default value: 0 (not italicized)
attrs.name: trendValueFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border color for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderColor

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the background of the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueBgAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the border around the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets padding for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the radius for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the thickness for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Sets whether the border around the trend-line display value will be drawn as a dashed line. 

Default value: 0 (drawn as a straight line)
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash, if the border around the trend-line display value is drawn as a dashed line.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between each dash, if the border around the trend-line display value is drawn as a dashed line.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashGap

description:
These attributes let you customize the text displayed with a trend-line. 

__Note__: These attributes belong to the `chart` object and  not to the `line` object (child of the `trendline` object). They are, therefore, applied to all trend-lines on your chart.
